column4: ok, I've now found a new rpm package with new drivers for my printers, it's an "src.rpm" which apparently means it contains the source in there, anyone know what I must use to open it extract the source from there so I can then do a make install of the source?

Canon Pixma MP160: works fine over the network via cups when connected to an XP machine but steadfastly refuses to work when via USB to this box despite following all the instructions I found in the ubuntu forum and linuxprinting and openprint
I had a pixima at one time.  let me think a while
ah.. I had problems installing this printer too.  think i ended up using turboprint or something.  *thinking*
this one seems alright.  sounds similar to what I did: http://openprinting.org/show_printer.cgi?recnum=Canon-Pixma_MP160
even has a guide for Ubuntu 7.10
pretty sure you will need alien regardless
In my experience, it was the most difficult printer to get working with linux (without closed-source turboprint).

I had read that one too :) will try that as well  Jack_Sparrow I think that the free version of turboprint puts a watermark of their company logo on prints though which isn't exactly ideal, thanks both of you, if all that fail I will try the newer canon file I found on the european website yesterday
Jack_Sparrow:  it does put a watermark on it
the method on that last post I gave you should work.  But if I remember, many setting (b/w only, etc.) don't work easily
you were telling me you used a canon pixma MP160 before or was that someone else?
never got it doing that.  cool!
what are you scanning with then?
